description:
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
At ByteDance, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for millions of users across all of our products. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at ByteDance.

Team Introduction
The platform governance and service team is responsible for ensuring a safe and trustworthy marketplace for all stakeholders: buyers, sellers and creators/influencers. We develop platform governance and risk assessment rules for all the participants and associated actions linked to the e-commerce platform. And with big data and various rules and algorithm models, we can identify those risks and abnormalities, evaluate the e-commerce ecosystem health to conduct timely guidance and intervention.

We are looking for talented individuals to join our team in 2023. As a graduate, you will get unparalleled opportunities for you to kickstart your career, pursue bold ideas and explore limitless growth opportunities. Co-create a future driven by your inspiration with ByteDance.

Successful candidates must be able to commit to one of the following start dates below:
1. July 17, 2023
2. August 14, 2023
3. September 5, 2023

We will prioritize candidates who are able to commit to these start dates. Please state your availability and graduation date clearly in your resume.

Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to ByteDance and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

Technical Assessment
Candidates who pass resume evaluation will be invited to participate in ByteDance's technical online assessment in HackerRank.

Responsibilities
  • Build a system that is data-and-algorithm-driven, with high concurrency, high availability, and low latency, including:
  • Dig deep into each important link of the e-commerce transaction pipeline, process and analyze e-commerce event data comprehensively and efficiently, and build loosely coupled system interactions together with various business fields.
  • Provides rich and flexible event access, processing, tracking and response capabilities
  • Provide advanced algorithms, rules and manual scheduling for calculation and risk identification capabilities, and maximizing identification efficiency, accuracy and throughput
  • Provides rapid data analysis capabilities for different areas (governance, experience and risk), ensuring we can efficiently develop and adopt new strategies to respond to rapid business needs and external threats
  • Provide flexible, efficient and accurate judgment and punishment capabilities, responding quickly to the changing requirements of the e-commerce platform.
  • Provide a wide array of features for consumers, merchants, and influencers to ensure that they have great experience and maximize their gain.
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline
  • Final year or recent graduate with a background in Software Development, Computer
Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline.
  • Experience with coding in Python, Java, Golang, C#, or C++.
  • Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, work experience, coding competitions, or publications.
  • High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving capabilities.
ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

ByteDance Inc. is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@ByteDance.com.

description:
We are Locana!

Locana is a global leader in technology consulting and geospatial systems development. We leverage location data, business intelligence, and integrated systems to drive enterprise collaboration and business performance for our public and private clients. With our top-tier partnerships and full-lifecycle approach, Locana delivers all components of a geospatial program; data collection, spatial processing, analytics and intelligence, application development, and mobile solution development.

Who we are looking for:

We are looking for a talented full stack GIS Software Developer who has a passion for working collaboratively and exceeding client expectations. As a Geospatial Software Developer, you will participate in all phases of development and implementation of geospatial components, applications, and solutions to solve our clients’ challenges. Depending on the client project, the work to be performed may be no code (all out-of-the box configuration), low code (e.g., configuration with some customization), or full custom development (e.g., developing a custom software application). Our Developers work as members of remote project teams, and occasionally travel locally or nationally.

Here are the skills and experience we are looking for:

  • 5-7 years of experience with ESRI GIS application development, and familiarity with configuring, extending, and developing within numerous ESRI technologies
  • Full stack development experience including familiarity with web and mobile application development, service development, systems integration, and database design and development
  • Experience in all phases of the application/solution development and delivery lifecycle
  • Experience with object-oriented design and development
  • Experience with ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal); ArcGIS APIs for JavaScript, Python, and REST; ArcGIS Runtime SDK
  • Experience with Javascript, Python, and SQL
  • Some experience with systems integration helpful but not strictly required

We use a variety of tools at Locana, so it is important that you have experience deploying different platforms and frameworks and, just as important, are interested in learning new ones. You are a self-starter and have been recognized for your leadership acumen and enjoy working independently as well as in a collaborative team environment. We are looking for communicators who possess the ability to get things done and deliver quality solutions.

We know that our team works hard for us, so we shower you with exciting perks and benefits, including:

  • A flexible schedule to allow for work-life balance
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans with a very low employee premium
  • Healthcare Spending Accounts (HSAs) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) (healthcare, dependent care, and commuter)
  • Short and long-term disability insurance and life insurance
  • 401k plan with a generous employer contribution
  • Plentiful PTO
  • 9 paid holidays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous annual home office reimbursement
  • And more

Interested? Great, we’d love to hear from you! Please click apply to get your information to us and we will reach out soon.


Locana offers a competitive compensation package including salary, bonus, and highly valued benefits programs. We are also working to increase wage transparency in an effort to create equity and equality. The annual starting salary range for this position is $80,000 - $110,000. Highly qualified individuals may have the opportunity to earn more.

Locana is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a diverse, inclusive, and equitable work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

description:
About Us

Union.ai is a Seattle-based startup founded by a team of former Lyft engineers. We contribute to Flyte, an open source platform for orchestrating massively scalable machine learning pipelines running on Kubernetes.

These pipelines power some of the most popular apps on your phone, as well as applications in diverse industries such as song sharing, vaccine research, early cancer detection, global map rendering, financial projecting, and piloting autonomous vehicles.

The Opportunity

Here at Union.ai, we are an open source first company! We provide infrastructure for our customers to build delightful Machine Learning driven products and deliver them in production. As the lead Python engineer, you will be working on our Flyte OSS product. Our ideal candidate will get immense satisfaction out of knowing and upholding the intricacies and nuances of the Python language. This person will guide us in setting best practices around how our community and team members write performant Python code and tooling.

In this role, you will:

  • Lead the development of Python products at Union (e.g. flytekit, unionml, pandera)

  • Advocate for best practices across the Python language

  • Go deep. Implement a DSL that mirrors the Python core language

  • Get satisfaction out of understanding and solving our users’ ML and data challenges

  • Learn about new tools and libraries in the ML landscape, understanding their impact and use-cases, and implementing elegant integrations within Flyte

About You:

  • 5+ years as a backend engineer with 2+ years of experience in Python

  • Professional background in a Data science/engineering and ML

  • Experience building Python libraries and compilers

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience

  • Experience with ML Frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow, etc) or Data processing frameworks (Spark, Flink, Beam etc) a plus

  • Open-source contributions in Python is a plus

  • Knowledge of Rust and PyO3 is a plus

Benefits & Belonging

At Union.ai we know that employees who feel their best can build amazing things and we are proud to offer best in class benefits that will continually evolve and grow as the needs of our employees do. Benefits may vary based on country

  • Excellent medical - We pay 100% of your premiums and 90% for your dependents

  • Generous dental and vision plans- We pay 80% of the premiums for you and your dependents

  • Meaningful equity in the form of options – all employees are owners here

  • Unlimited PTO + 12 company holidays

  • 401K match: Union.ai matches 100% of contributions up to the first 3%, and 50% up to 5%

  • 12 weeks paid parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers

  • Flexible work schedule at a remote friendly company

We believe that our differences are what bring us together to achieve truly special outcomes. We strive to be inclusive and focus on building teams that embody that quality too. Union.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and we encourage you to apply, even if your experience doesn’t align exactly with our job description.

Compensation Range: $170K - $215K

Job Summary and Mission

From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition but also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others.

This position contributes to Starbucks' success by delivering and supporting Supply Chain Technology Initiatives and is primarily responsible for building, enhancing, and supporting enterprise-scale products spanning Starbucks' Supply Chain Business Functions, including Source, Make, and Deliver.

A pragmatic software engineer with deep technical expertise, domain knowledge, and platform knowledge is required for this role. Typical activities include research, analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, training, and documentation - adhering to and evolving standards and procedures throughout the entire life cycle of complex projects. As well as delivering new technology and enhancing/supporting existing applications, this role will also contribute relevant technical, functional, and process expertise, negotiate and drive alignment, and coach and mentor colleagues. Models and acts according to Starbucks' guiding principles.


Summary of Key Responsibilities

  • Leverage established design patterns and standards to develop solutions at scale for business problems
  • Participate in activities related to requirements gathering and functional specification.
  • Participate in Solution Design, Development, and Core Platform Enhancements
  • Ensure software development standards are met by participating in engineering reviews with the team
  • Partner with teams to establish best practices to shape engineering culture.
  • Collaborate with team members to recommend new software development technologies and development processes.
  • Conduct root cause analysis on production issues, resolve them, and mitigate their effects.
  • Contribute to the development of teams' knowledge bases for existing and ongoing work.
  • Contribute to large-scale projects and programs in both waterfall and Agile Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) processes and methodologies.

Summary of Experience

  • 3+ Years of hands-on Oracle EBS Development and Technical Experience developing RICEW components (Reports, Interfaces, Conversions, Extensions, and Workflows).
  • Working knowledge of Processes such as Procure to Pay, Distribution, Order to Cash, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Master Data.
  • Proven expertise in programming languages such as Java and Python, as well as a mastery of object-oriented design and programming.
  • Strong experience with SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle Applications Framework (OAF), Oracle Forms (10g), Oracle Reports, UNIX shell scripting, Workflow & XML Publisher.
  • Hands-on experience with Oracle EBS modules such as Warehouse Management (WMS), Inventory (INV), Order Management (OM), Shipping (WSH), Purchasing (PO), Account Payables (AP), Payments (IBY), Oracle Process Manufacturing (OPM) , General Ledger (GL), Cash Management (CM), and Sub Ledger Accounting (SLA).
  • Development, troubleshooting, and debugging experience with REST APIs.
  • Expertise in developing data pipelines using Spark, ADF, and other tools.

  • Working knowledge of distributed data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, etc.)

  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing

Preferred Qualifications

  • Working Knowledge of one or more ERP, CRM, e-Commerce, or mobile packaged solutions (e.g. Salesforce.com, NetSuite, Oracle, SAP, Workday, Ariba, etc.) .
  • Hands on experience with iPaaS applications like Oracle SOA Suite, Dell Boomi, Mule Soft, or Apache NiFi is a plus.
  • Hands-on Experience developing Microservices.

description:
Use Your Powers for Good.

Are you a software developer that is wildly concerned about the environment or maybe an environmental scientist who has serious programming chops? If the answer is yes, we would love for you to consider joining our team. We have a unique position that would be perfect for someone with solid programming training and a desire to apply these skills to solving environmental challenges.


Specifically, we are looking for a new teammate who is familiar with the environmental science/engineering domain that also has excellent programming skills focused on data analysis and visualization with web programming techniques; familiarity with relational database technologies; knowledge of cloud-based architectures and web-mapping technologies; an understanding of how to conceptualize and build end-to-end website architecture for small web platforms for scientific audiences to store and visualize data; and strong written and verbal communication skills. Duties will be broken up approximately as follows:

  • System development (45%)—Develop environmental data management systems for a variety of projects focusing on cloud-based architecture, online data entry, real-time data acquisition, and online data visualization
  • Data analysis (45%)—Assist scientific research teams with data mining and analytics
  • Existing systems maintenance (10%)—Maintain existing data management systems and web applications including bug fixes, new feature development, and performance tuning

Must Haves

  • EITHER a bachelor’s degree in environmental science, environmental engineering, or a related discipline and a web programming boot camp type course OR a bachelor’s degree in computer science, informatics, or related discipline
  • Proficiency in Python programming language and SQL
  • Training in web development and data visualization using JavaScript
  • Strong interest in environmental science and/or natural resource management
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills

Nice to Haves

  • Experience with Pandas data manipulation library and Django web development framework
  • Experience working with spatial data and web mapping
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services
  • Experience with environmental, natural resource, and/or wildlife data management and analysis

Our Story

The Four Peaks Environmental Science & Data Solutions, LLC (Four Peaks) is an environmental science and engineering firm helping solve environmental challenges in our rivers, lakes, and oceans. We apply our expertise in data science, aquatic research, water resource management, and regulatory compliance in order to equip our clients with the information they need to make important decisions. Our projects have included work on salmon recovery and Clean Water Act compliance, and we take pride in the positive impact our projects have on our communities. The Four Peaks Data Solutions team builds the technological scaffolding that supports our environmental research. Specifically, our projects involve developing data management and analytics systems that transform environmental data into readily accessible information to support environmental management decisions.


Our firm is committed to ensuring a diverse, equitable, and inclusive community. Through this commitment we hope to positively impact our local, regional, national, and global communities—those same communities in which we operate. We live our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion at Four Peaks as core values through how we hire, promote, and develop our team. We are determined to pursue these values to build a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive day-to-day workplace and company culture.


Summary of Employee Benefits

  • Annual profit and performance-based bonus
  • Performance-based incentive compensation
  • Employer sponsored health insurance
  • 401k program with employer match
  • 10 paid holidays and a generous paid time off program
  • Cell phone allowance
  • Flexible work options (e.g., remote vs. in-person, non-traditional hours)
  • Reimbursement for equipping a home office

Hiring Process

We’re small, so we employ a human (not an ATS) to review all our applications. We’d love it if you dropped us a line via a short cover letter along with your resume and let us know why you think we’d be a great match (aka please don't just bot respond).


Qualified applicants will meet with the Data Solutions team and other members of the company but we don’t require days-long interview marathons. Instead, our process includes posing a thoughtful timeboxed problem task that is similar to what the successful applicant will encounter while working here (no riddles or LeetCode). We think this gives us all realistic expectations.

description:
An extraordinarily talented group of individuals work together every day to drive TNS' success, from both professional and personal perspectives. Come join the excellence!
Overview
The candidate will work on the Provisioning and Data services in TNS’s Communications Handset Services development team. This role is critical to delivering TNS services to our carrier partners’ customers and delivering revenue to the organization.

Our software consumes and produces a lot of data. Your primary responsibility is to keep data flowing and ensure its quality and completeness. The data architecture is built around Cassandra, Percona XtraDB, Spark and Flume. Data exploration with Zeppelin is used to drive data management tasks for your Reporting co-workers.

You will have a role in maintaining and enhancing the carrier software infrastructure used by our customers and millions of their customers. Your knowledge with Perl, Java and Python will be essential to maintaining and developing software. Your experience with Cassandra, Spark and Flume is important for our data pipeline needs. Our Java projects build with Gradle (and occasionally Ant).
Responsibilities
Candidates will be responsible for administering Cassandra, Spark and MySQL/Percona clusters. The successful candidate must have strong problem-solving skills. They will use languages and technologies as tools and have a desire to see issues through to completion. Our data originates in Java applications used by mobile devices and carrier infrastructure.
Maintain Cassandra Cluster
Ensure SUR/SPO services are running and processing data
Continue Cassandra repair process
Continue Cassandra deletion process
Maintain audit process and ensure jobs complete
Qualifications
REQUIRED (MINIMUM):
5 or more years of Software Development and Operations experience comprised of:
3 or more years of experience with Java, Cassandra, Flume, Log4j2 and integrating/using a variety of open source projects.
3 or more years of experience managing MySQL/Percona clusters
3 or more years of Linux administrative experience with Apache’s Cassandra, Spark and Flume applications

Possess excellent verbal & written communication skills
Have the desire and ability to work in a team environment
Strong commitment to developing quality software
Have an Agile Mindset
Experience in the field of telecommunications is desired
Education and Years of Experience
Bachelor's degree in a related technical field or the equivalent work experience. Minimum 5 years of progressively responsible related technical experience.

You will have the opportunity to work on innovative software solutions that are at the forefront of healthcare technology – aimed at delivering quality clinicians to patients in need faster than ever before. You will be part of a team of talented and passionate engineers who are committed to driving positive change and advancing the healthcare industry.

So, if you're a rebel with a cause, a misfit with a mission, a troublemaker with a vision, and ready to join the ranks of the "crazy ones," the ones who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Actriv Healthcare.

Together, we can shape the future of patient care and push the human race forward.

ON ANY GIVEN DAY, YOU COULD BE DOING THESE THINGS

  • Design and build applications for different platforms

WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU: Knowledge

  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject
  • Minimum 5 years in software development
  • Experience with different SDK’s
  • Experience with Python, Java, Javascript and AWS
  • Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON and building server-side APIs and Client-Server interactions
  • Experience with third-party libraries
  • Ability to manage your workload with minimal supervision


Attributes

  • Well-developed interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent analytical skills, highly intuitive, decisive, and "get it done" mentality.
  • Ability to think outside the box, brainstorm and ideate with other teams
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, high growth environment where handling pressure and achieving deadlines are normal.
  • Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and quick to solve issues.
  • Approach to work that is positive, solution-oriented, optimistic, and enthusiastic.
  • Ability to adapt to rapidly changing/evolving growth and respond strategically to organizational needs.
  • Ability to shift between big picture strategic thinking and day-to-day tactical and operational execution.
  • Metrics-oriented and customer and employee satisfaction-driven.
  • Exceptional presentation, organization, and communication skills (written and verbal).

WE CARE ABOUT OUR ACTRIVIAN TEAM

  • Employee and Family Medical, Dental, and Vision
  • Short and Long Term Disability

About Actriv Healthcare

Actriv Healthcare is reinventing the way healthcare professionals connect with facilities - leveraging technology to help healthcare professionals do what they love by matching them with shifts that fit their lifestyles. Actriv’s solutions ensure that health care facilities get on-demand shift coverage so they can deliver the best quality care to their patients. With offices in Tacoma, Seattle, Vancouver (WA), and Plano, TX, Actriv’s customer-centric professionals recruit clinicians and offer an unparalleled experience from on-boarding, credentialing, and training; to providing day to day 24/7 support.

description:
About Us

Union.ai is a Seattle-based startup founded by a team of former Lyft engineers. We contribute to Flyte, an open source platform for orchestrating massively scalable machine learning pipelines running on Kubernetes.

These pipelines power some of the most popular apps on your phone, as well as applications in diverse industries such as song sharing, vaccine research, early cancer detection, global map rendering, financial projecting, and piloting autonomous vehicles.

The Opportunity

Here at Union.ai, we are an open source first company! We provide infrastructure for our customers to build delightful Machine Learning driven products and deliver them in production. As the lead Python engineer, you will be working on our Flyte OSS product. Our ideal candidate will get immense satisfaction out of knowing and upholding the intricacies and nuances of the Python language. This person will guide us in setting best practices around how our community and team members write performant Python code and tooling.

In this role, you will:

  • Lead the development of Python products at Union (e.g. flytekit, unionml, pandera)

  • Advocate for best practices across the Python language

  • Go deep. Implement a DSL that mirrors the Python core language

  • Get satisfaction out of understanding and solving our users’ ML and data challenges

  • Learn about new tools and libraries in the ML landscape, understanding their impact and use-cases, and implementing elegant integrations within Flyte

About You:

  • 5+ years as a backend engineer with 2+ years of experience in Python

  • Professional background in a Data science/engineering and ML

  • Experience building Python libraries and compilers

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience

  • Experience with ML Frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow, etc) or Data processing frameworks (Spark, Flink, Beam etc) a plus

  • Open-source contributions in Python is a plus

  • Knowledge of Rust and PyO3 is a plus

Benefits & Belonging

At Union.ai we know that employees who feel their best can build amazing things and we are proud to offer best in class benefits that will continually evolve and grow as the needs of our employees do. Benefits may vary based on country

  • Excellent medical - We pay 100% of your premiums and 90% for your dependents

  • Generous dental and vision plans- We pay 80% of the premiums for you and your dependents

  • Meaningful equity in the form of options – all employees are owners here

  • Unlimited PTO + 12 company holidays

  • 401K match: Union.ai matches 100% of contributions up to the first 3%, and 50% up to 5%

  • 12 weeks paid parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers

  • Flexible work schedule at a remote friendly company

We believe that our differences are what bring us together to achieve truly special outcomes. We strive to be inclusive and focus on building teams that embody that quality too. Union.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and we encourage you to apply, even if your experience doesn’t align exactly with our job description.

Compensation Range: $170K - $215K

description:
When visionary companies need to know how their world-changing ideas will perform, they close the gap between design and reality with Ansys simulation. For more than 50 years, Ansys software has enabled innovators across industries to push boundaries by using the predictive power of simulation. From sustainable transportation to advanced semiconductors, from satellite systems to life-saving medical devices, the next great leaps in human advancement will be powered by Ansys.


Take a leap of certainty … with Ansys.


Summary / Role Purpose

The Senior R&D Engineer is responsible for the development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the Senior R&D Engineer will use advanced technical and problem-solving skills to help the team tackle complex issues, satisfy customer requirements, and accomplish development objectives.


Key Duties and Responsibilities

  • Participates in planning, architecture, and research
  • Performs complex development activities that may require extensive analysis in areas including user experience, software design and solver research in thermal/fluid simulation (flow network aka thermohydraulics, not 2D/3D CFD)
  • Employs best practices and helps to maintain them through technical reviews and mentoring
  • Performs complex bug verification, release testing and beta support for assigned products. Researches problems discovered by QA or product support and develops solutions
  • Researches and understands the marketing requirements for a product, including target environment, performance criteria and competitive issues. May work with strategic customers or proxies to assess needs and develop solutions
  • Works independently with minimal supervision and may take on some planning and mentoring responsibilities
  • May be responsible for managing interns or co-ops but typically does not have direct reports


Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience

  • BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with 5 years’ experience, MS with 3 years’ experience, or PhD with 1 year experience
  • Experience with software design and development methodologies using Fortran, C, and C++
  • Demonstrated technical knowledge of thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, and heat transfer


Preferred Qualifications and Skills

  • Excellent technical knowledge and commercial experience with algorithms and computational efficiency, AutoCAD ARX development, OpenMP, C# and Python
  • Experience using Ansys products, especially Thermal Desktop with FloCAD
    • Experience using or authoring other thermohydraulic or flow network design and simulation products
    • Experience using CAD, FEA, and CFD design and simulation products
  • Passion for crafting robust and efficient code
  • Experience delivering high-quality products in a large-scale commercial software development environment
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a geographically distributed team


At Ansys, we know that changing the world takes vision, skill, and each other. We fuel new ideas, build relationships, and help each other realize our greatest potential in the knowledge that every day is an opportunity to observe, teach, inspire, and be inspired. Together as One Ansys, we are powering innovation that drives human advancement.


Our Commitments:

  • Amaze with innovative products and solutions
  • Make our customers incredibly successful
  • Act with integrity
  • Ensure employees thrive and shareholders prosper

Our Values:

  • Adaptability: Be open, welcome what’s next
  • Courage: Be courageous, move forward passionately
  • Generosity: Be generous, share, listen, serve
  • Authenticity: Be you, make us stronger


Our Actions:

  • We commit to audacious goals
  • We work seamlessly as a team
  • We demonstrate mastery
  • We deliver outstanding results


OUR ONE ANSYS CULTURE HAS INCLUSION AT ITS CORE
We believe diverse thinking leads to better outcomes. We are committed to creating and nurturing a workplace that fuels this by welcoming people, no matter their background, identity, or experience, to a workplace where they are valued and where diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging thrive.


TAKE A LEAP OF CERTAINTY IN YOUR CAREER AT ANSYS

At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in working with well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high – met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head on. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology, empowering our customers to turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at a lower cost.


At Ansys, it’s about the learning, the discovery, and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished.” And it’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can, and do impact real people in real ways. All this is forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy, and ethics.


CREATING A PLACE WE’RE PROUD TO BE
Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a member of the NASDAQ-100. We are proud to have been recognized for the following more recent awards, although our list goes on: America’s Most Loved Workplaces, Gold Stevie Award Winner, America’s Most Responsible Companies, Fast Company World Changing Ideas, Great Place to Work Certified (China, Greece, France, India, Japan, Korea, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, U.K.).



For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com


Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.
